post.body: Oh god no, keep it with the election, you DONT want them starting on deregulation, oh god no....
not too bad here, busy as hell, looking forward to a break at Christmas and yourself?
nice one :)
Using dimmer switches with energy saving bulbs also causes your electrics to blow, happened to pal, not many know that!
:) remember she was the one you provided anti-virus advice to. Having slagged me for years for blogging, she is mad into it :)
a pal was a fluffy link yesterday, she got a surge of visitors and is thrilled to bits, she loves you :)
welcome to twitter :) Say hi to @picoroco everyone
ah you're a star, but I picked up another one instead, thanks anyway. Anyone else looking 4 gud bk 4 boys http://url.ie/zzi
hearty congratulations, yes sleep is important between now and then, its a pity it can be stored for use at a later time ;)
I use both, but I do love my mac, it will be gentle with you so don;t worry ;)
should I know this, if so I blame Christmas drinks, whats happening in Feb?
mac mac mac mac mac, I didn't get office but I use google docs for wordy stuff!
just found this on google notebooks and thinking of doing a lot of it http://url.ie/10of
couple of snappers I know swear by them, easier 2 use than mousepad, apparently. I'll soon find out if I have thrown away money :)
if they were smart they would.
apparently they are, a pal complained in Debenhams about that, poor shop assistant agreed with her.
particularly given the last few months there is a part of me that feels that.
I am not talking about removing someone's right to complain (is there such a thing!) I am saying they will get my complaint
I know, but if you haven't voted at all, then you cannot complain. In the north we never had say over british govt
and let us not forget the absolute enthralled irish people at american elections. They can get interested when they want
you could also say not voting is handing the gun to someone else to make decisions for us all
and believe me growing up in the north where few friends felt represented by political parties, still decisions made for you.
I feel that apathy is one thing but apathy is hitting me hard. I've let it slide, no more. (dats fightin talk)
I'll be donating directly, credit card maxed out, chanced and chanced me arm, wouldn;'t go and they don;t take laser, ggrr
I have understood it, never agreed, but their non-voting hits me & has decisions made that hot me. So they better watch out
the first person in coming yr who says they have no interest in politics and wont vote will probably get a thick ear from me
just enabled a whole load of new things on gmail, such as texting US phones. to do lists and forgotten attachment reminder!
morning all if I nominate @mcawilliams for shorty award, do I say its because he never shuts up, I mean never stops twittering ;)
Sitting down for the evening in front of corrie, about to have dinner and go through the pics from this afternoon. Fun fun ;)
damn damn, morning has run away without me and Im not finished my morning to do list and am off shortly to take pics, in the rain...
HA HA @davymac, I've been here, you obviously didn't notice :(
Morning everyone, wet and miserable here in Dublin and I have a long list of things to do. *Big sigh*. Hows everyone else?
Have to say I love hearing the rain hit the skylight on cold evenings like this, particularly given now I have central heating :)
Just posted about the Cork and Dublin vigils http://url.ie/yqv, now for some photo-editing, I have a feeling its going to be a late night.
Just got poster for vigil, please download & circulate :) http://www.flickr.com/photos/redmum/3079200741
Check this out, a pal did it, for next to nothing, its brilliant. http://tinyurl.com/6y2ych
Just got the poster for the vigils and it looks great, will post once I cross Ts and dot Is :)
Good morning everyone, -2c at Leinster House. The gritters were out last night, judging by frost everywhere were needed. Maybe snow?
so if you are in Cork on December 10th at 6.30pm, its happening at Dawn Square, Dublin event happening at the same time at the Dáil.
FFS was told about a brilliant book for 8(ish)-year-old boy, perfect as pressie, OF COURSE it was sold out when I went at lunchtime!!!
Lidl had a great offer of an image tablet this morning, they were gone in three city centre stores by 10am!!!! Next time I queue at 8am
Morning everyone :) Any craic?
just got the fail whale, twitter is over capacity, early on Sunday! Morning/afternoon everyone, contemplating getting up but tis cold.
Not even the last runup 2 xmas & already my liver is taking a bashing, & more 2 follow next week.Damn you Christmas drinks *shakes fist*
Trying to update my blog and scanning all sorts of articles from this week's vigils, we got fantastic coverage, will link to them later
Seems Nanny's pal managed to get me the tablet I was complaining about not getting in Lidl last week, http://url.ie/10o8 big smiles from me
PS dont tell the Young Wan among her pressies is ipod shuffle. She lost 2 in short period of time and I swore I wouldn't get her another.
given the pound and euro are nearly on par, shops need to pass on the savings or people will continue to go north
Nanny back from Belfast, among the bargains is a box of Tesco Soave wine for £11, its 23euro here, ipod shuffle £31, 45 euro here.
I am allowed to feel that, and when I said a box on the ear, you could be taking me too literally
and its a big jump from me giving out to someone who isnt voting to censorship
